storyInfo: The town storyteller, a Mr. Umbrella-Boiler, is rather hospitable, and Lava comes to know many stories about this 'P'o-shan Village.' And yet, she is unable to connect them to the Yen she knows. At the same time, a wandering monk from Higashi strikes up a conversation.

attributes.content: I see. You sought your friend's family for her, and so came from shy a myriad li away to Yen. Admirable indeed.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: However, Mount Hui-ch'i? And Kou-wu City? I've never heard of any cities like it in the vicinity... But this place isn't far from Mount Sky. Perhaps it's a small peak I know not the name of. The possibility is there.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Eh? Mount Sky...?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Well, this is annoying.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Sorry, could I ask which part of Yen we're in right now?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: This place is at the edge of Mount P'o, its name is P'o-shan Village.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: (I've never heard of it, absolutely never heard of it!)
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Oâ€”okay, then, what's the current year...?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: The year is Ching-tso 7, currently the Beginning of Spring, with the Dusk Ridding just passed.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: (Quietly) Ching-tso?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: (Quietly) Benefactor, I won't mince words: my history is quite poor, but Ching-tso... has to be centuries ago at least. I've never heard of an era by that name...
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: (Quietly) Wh... what's going on, benefactor? Could we have tumbled a thousand years back when we opened that door?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: (Quietly) Did they have gardens and buildings like this a thousand years ago?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: (Quietly) Of course they couldn't! Perhaps this Umbrella-Boiling Hermit blurted out pure nonsense? But I can't imagine he'd do that, noting how refined his manner is.
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Heroes three, you've come to our aid. You are my honored guests. If you have any questions, ask them forthright; you needn't refrain.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Could we trouble you to tell us about the culture and customs here? To be honest, this place isn't where we thought we were going. It seems we went astray, and we're sort of at a loss.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: For... for example, tell us about this village?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Ah... there is much to tell of the origins of P'o-shan Village. Story has it that seventy years ago, a great fire started on a rich merchant's property, bringing untold calamity.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: The rich merchant was frightened, and planned to leave, to find a place where nature blessed treasured lands, so he could live out the rest of his days.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Subsequently, in the midst of all the ashes, the people of his village found a peculiar painting on the ground...
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Painting?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Correct. The house had burned to the ground, yet that painting scroll remained unharmed, and after brushing off the ash, it was as good as new.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: The merchant heard of the painting, dove deep into his pockets to buy it back once again, seeking good luck to ward against fires.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: In his new residence, the more the merchant gazed into the scenery in the painting, the more he took an interest. He sent out hundreds of servants in search of the marvelous feng shui this scroll had portrayedâ€”
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: â€”and so came here, and so this village, and this garden came to be.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Was that your ancestor?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Not so, not so. The world's affairs are never constant. Decades in the past, after the merchant's death, his few sons in their incompetence frittered away the household's wealth.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: By chance, my father had some spare money from a string of opportune coincidences, and so bought the gardens and settled down here.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Afterwards, as nearby Catastrophes were infrequent and the mountains and rivers gorgeous, many talented scholars were drawn here, and over time, P'o-shan Village became as it is today.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: (I mean, it sounds wonderful.)
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: (No issues with it yet, I think...)
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: So, the color of the sky...?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: The what?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Uh, I mean, daytime and nighttime seem to be mixed together...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: We've always worked as the sun rose, and rested as it set. What doubts might you have?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: It's been two hours since the bell sounded... with the twelve-branch double-hour system, it'd be one of those. The sun's hasn't moved at all. What's causing that?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: The sun? Move?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: The sun and moon sit in the sky, sun in the east, moon in the west, eternally unchanging. What other position would they assume?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Hm? You all have a peculiar look on your faces. Have I said something improper?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Er, benefactors, if I could interrupt, just very quickly.
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: May I dare ask, will you again be telling stories here the next day?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Naturally.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: As that is the case tomorrow, I presume yesterday you also took up your hand fan and gavel block?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: I lay at home, with the collection of strange tales as my one and only hobby, naught but the art of storytelling to pass the time. Thus, every day, in the two afternoon hours of the Monkey, changing for nothing.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Err. Then with the sun and moon constant above, and 'today, the next day, and yesterday,' how should you define what one 'day' is?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: You're quite the jokester, Brother No. Twelve earthly branches make up one day. Need you ask?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Erm... do the twelve branches and the twenty-four hours not track the time over one day and night?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Hmm? How mystifying. I wonder just where you all came from? The twelve branches indicate the necessary periods between the sun rising above the earth in the far east, and the moon above the mountains in the far west, don't they?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Of course, they also indicate how this road is partitioned. East to west, P'o-shan Village lies from the late-morn sixth to the late-eve twelfth.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: I've heard tell of mountains beyond mountains. Could it be that beyond Mount Hung-tung and downstream of the Tung-shÃªng River, other places are not so?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Then... suppose P'o-shan Village alone occupies such a vast domain; if there are villages elsewhere, mightn't they be forever without daylight?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Or they'd be stuck in the day, and they'd never even sleep properly. Sucks to be them.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: This... this, I am truly unclear on.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Have you never left this village before? Aren't there any other travelers here?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: I never have. Very few people have ever come here, and of the youth that leave, very few ever return.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: I must confess, the 'Yen' we presently know is from the library the rich merchant left behind, and nothing more.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Has a Catastrophe never struck this place before?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: They're just as rare. At least apart from the ancient records, our three generations have never seen one before.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: And so, we hardly leave the bounds of P'o-shan Village. And just as you see, scarcely any travelers come here, let alone any officials or Messengers or other such persons.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: To say P'o-shan Village is presently cut off from the outside world would be no exaggeration at all. That said, only when you disregard the affairs of the world can you be content.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: And the monsters?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Ah... I know not when it began. Come every Dusk Ridding, Mount Hung-tung often bears monsters that come to disturb the village, over perhaps three to five days. For so many unbroken years, it has been this way.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: In these years, I've turned every record over, asked the very few strangers whenever I could, and I've never found any way to address it...
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: But as long as you hide somewhere the sun is, those monsters won't come near.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Versus braving the dangers and battling them 'til one side is dead, much better is finding peace and safety, hiding under the sun, passing not a night and staying vigil throughout...
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Over time, it's become a usual practice of ours here.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Dear me! And I thought this place was a true peach-blossom utopia! I hadn't imagined such troubles here... Those monsters are much too frightening. To give them a wide berth is the sensible thing!
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: (Quietly) Benefactors, their ways are plainly much too strange...
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Sir, one last question.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: You know that we came here to look for someone. I have a, uh, token. Could you take a look?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: This is...?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Hoh...
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Craft to surpass Nature.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: However... most regretfully, if I'd ever seen such an unusual item as this before, I'd certainlyâ€”
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Sir, the feast is prepared.
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: Good, good. May I ask you all if you've found anywhere to stay in the village?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Not for the time being...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: You've arrived as guests. It'd be best if you rested here for some days, and once the Dusk Ridding has passed, you hurry on your way again!
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: (Quietly) Benefactor, your verdict?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: (Quietly) It's not like we've got anywhere to go... We may as well stay in the village for now and gather intel.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: (Quietly) This place obviously doesn't match up with the 'Yen' we know. Not to mention, we still have no indication of how we got here...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Right!
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: In that case, we'd be best to accept.
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: So in the end, we still don't have a literal clue... Eh, but the tea here smells great. Is this how the green tea is in Yen?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Kroos!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Don't worry, I've got my manners.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: I could drink this.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: They've put out fruits here...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Ah, are you testing for poison, benefactors? You should've said sooner; let me come to your aid!
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Hey...!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Mmph!
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Mm, dear benefactor, this fruit is quite fresh! And peculiarly sweet.
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: I didn't mean...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Mind it not! As the proverb goes, one cannot lack the heart to protect, no?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: I wasn't worried if they poisoned anything... I was just checking through... everything in our perimeter.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: You're pretty fidgety right now, aren't you? No problem, we're all the same. Lost in the fog.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: It's like we're checking if we're even still alive.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Checking again, huh?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: You chill here. I still need to take another look outside.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: How could I leave my benefactor to toil alone! I must accompany you!
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Then let's split up and move. The way things are, none of us is gonna sit still.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Alright. Then shall we meet in... two hours?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Do you think we can trust him?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Even if it's not rare to see poor bastards in a tight spot on the wastes, coincidences like his are the last thing you can trust.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: I think so too. And it's a fact that he's been deceiving us.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Gloompincers that leave their nests are highly aggressive. And when we found him, he was up in a tree looking all sad... but he was about 800 whole meters away from the car crash.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: And just seeing his actions...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Even if he's got no ill will, we've still gotta be wary of each other.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: I'll keep an eye on him.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: (I may have been drawn into something indescribably bizarre... But I suppose that has had a silver lining...)
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: (Speaking of which, this truly isn'tâ€”any joking matter... If I can't find a way to return, then what do I even do...)
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: (Oh... but Lava and Kroos have been quite the saviors to me. I can't fault them for this... *sigh*! I'll just have to see as I goâ€”)
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Ohh, my apologies there, I'm truly sorry. I was lost in thought and clearly wasn't watching my wayâ€”
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: By your appearance, surely you are from outside, are you not? It has been so long since I saw a visitor!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: I am Saga, humble servant of the Buddha, a wandering monk from Higashi! May I ask from whence thou comest?
attributes.name: Saga
